items.title: Will this major cigarette player be able to beat the tax worries?
items.description: A possible taxation shock could create near-term demand headwinds

items.title: Wipro bolsters its ER&D footprint with an acquisition
items.description: The transaction should add about 3 percent to the company’s top line

items.title: Business in the Week Ahead (August 25-29, 2025)
items.description: A fresh week beckons. What should feature in your to-do list? Just like every week, we have put together a set of business and finance highlights that can decide your investment trajectory. India’s GDP figure stands out in the crowd

items.title: Centrum Capital to sell affordable housing finance business to Weaver Services for Rs 430 crore
items.description: Centrum Housing's enterprise valuation is approximately Rs 800 crore, and Centrum Capital owns little over 50 percent in the HFC. The listed entity will be getting around Rs 430 crore for the deal, a company spokesperson said.

items.title: Fabless chip firm Vervesemi shares roadmap of ICs in boost to India's semiconductor self-reliance
items.description: Vervesemi's upcoming portfolio of integrated circuits (ICs) are seen as a step towards accelerating India’s semiconductor self-reliance as well as driving global innovation. Vervesemi shared timelines for several notable ICs that will address critical applications.

items.title: YEIDA allots 190 acre parcel to Escorts Kubota for a Rs 4,500 crore tractor unit near Jewar airport
items.description: Apart from the Rs 4,500 crore investment for tractor manufacturing unit, Escorts Kubota's proposed investment will provide employment to 4,000 people in phased manner.

items.title: Hindalco's Rs 18,000 crore capex in FY25 was highest in a decade, says KM Birla, reaffirms $10 billion investment plan
items.description: On the downstream front, the Aditya Birla Group company has a target to quadruple EBITDA by FY30 compared to FY24 through the ramp up of new copper tubes plant and an e-waste recycling facility which will be India’s first and the world’s second largest.

items.title: Page Industries: Margins hold strong, but growth lags
items.description: Volume recovery rather than margin resilience to determine the stock performance going forward
